units.title: Perform multiplexed immunohistochemistry on FFPE tissue sections
units.text: For each retinal organoid and the primary adult tissue, we performed multiplexed immunohistochemistry on 3-μm-thick formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) sections (1–4 sections per sample; Supplementary Table 1 and Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: This is a clear, actionable protocol step describing sample preparation and treatment.

units.title: Acquire tiled images at ×40 magnification with high-NA silicone oil objective
units.text: We generated tiled images at ×40 magnification with a high-numerical-aperture (NA) silicone oil objective to cover length scales from the millimeter to the nanometer scale (pixel size, 0.1625 μm) (Fig. 1c).
units.rationale: This specifies imaging parameters and equipment, forming a reproducible experimental procedure.

units.title: Perform 21 immunohistochemical staining cycles with antibody elution
units.text: Here, we performed 21 immunohistochemical staining cycles. Images were acquired at ×40 magnification with a high-NA silicone oil objective, tiled across the tissue.
units.rationale: This describes a repeated, sequential protocol step critical to the 4i methodology.

units.title: Stain, acquire, denoise, register, and segment nuclei in 96-well format
units.text: Stain - Acquire - Denoise - Register - Segment nuclei
units.rationale: This is a direct, stepwise protocol sequence from the figure legend describing image processing workflow.

units.title: Use communal pixel clustering to define 32 multiplexed tissue units (MTUs)
units.text: Thirty-two global MTUs resolve the tissue structure with image quality and label biological structures in individual samples.
units.rationale: This states a key analytical protocol step for defining spatial units from imaging data.

units.title: Visualize protein expression patterns using UMAP embedding
units.text: Focusing on segmented nuclei in an exemplary 39-week organoid section, variance analysis in the protein expression feature space and visualization in a uniform manifold approximation and projection (UMAP) embedding revealed eight molecularly distinct nuclei clusters.
units.rationale: This describes a computational protocol step for dimensionality reduction and clustering of protein data.

units.title: Assign cell types to nuclei clusters by integrating with scRNA-seq data
units.text: Comparison of protein expression with single-cell transcriptomes14 enabled cell type assignment to each nuclei cluster (Fig. 1h,i and Supplementary Fig. 4e,f).
units.rationale: This is a specific, actionable integration protocol between imaging and sequencing data.

units.title: Apply iterative indirect immunofluorescence imaging (4i) on retinal organoid tissues
units.text: we established an experimental pipeline for performing iterative indirect immunofluorescence imaging (4i)22 on histological sections of retinal organoids at high spatial resolution
units.rationale: This introduces the core methodological protocol used in the study.
